This game is both scary & addicting! For some reason their seems to be a decent crossover between people who enjoy League of Legends & Dead By Daylight. The learning curve can be a bit steep but it is a lot of fun and I was able to hit red rank while still having tons of room to improve on my gameplay! People get very tilted and the community has a set of unoffical rules that you will start to learn as you play, everyone has their own opinion about them but the developers clearly reward playing by the "unoffical book" through the bloodpoint reward system and how you rank up faster by camping less & running the killer. Playing killer and survivor feel like very different experiences, and you can very easily be tempted into buying cosmetics, I know I did, so be warned! One of my favorite games lately.

Great game. It feels pretty balanced as well in the higher ranks, but at lower ranks it can just feel brutally out of your hands...so you lose a lot before you start winning.

The core game on the Survivors side is to finish generators and escape before they are either all hooked by the killer, or hooked three times (after being taken down by other players or taking a high-risk and punishing self-escape attempt). The core part of that gameplay is entirely interrupted by the "Mori" item for killers which allows them to kill you directly - which on the Survivor side feels like rules of the game are changed, and the competitive aspect of the game reduced. 

The core game on the Killers side is to hit survivors two times putting them into a downed state, then picking them up and hooking the survivor. If the survivor is on the hook for long enough they are sacrificed, and if they escape the hook, you can remove them from play entirely by hooking them a total of three times. There is also a meta game of pushing survivors to finish generators in specific places to make the end game (when there are fewer generators left) closer together, and thus easier to eliminate the survivors. Wait times for playing killers is typically longer, and the learning curve is steep as you are often paired with experienced survivors.

Also, as a side not, the recent introduction of Crossplay has created some heavy bugs, glitches, and lengthier lobby times. Hopefully this is corrected soon.

Jogo merda que trava toda hora, merda de empresa fdp q não sabe arrumar a porra do servidor!! Jogo é lotado de bugs e quando vc consegue jogar, o servidor cai! Além disso, mesmo sabendo que a porra do problema do servidor não tem nada a ver com a minha internet ou com o meu pc, esses fdp te banem por disconnect!! 

Esses são um dos problemas do jogo. Mas não se limita a isso, também encontramos: erros de animação em quase todas as animações do jogo, problemas no pareamento de rank, por exemplo, ranks 5 caem contra ranks 15 o tempo todo, players ficam invisíveis no lobby, ou simplesmente não te acompanham ao achar uma partida. E por último, mas não menos importante, toda a partida alguém toma dc no começo e acaba fodendo todo seu up!! ( na maioria das vezes sendo erros de servidor por parte da própria empresa )

Além dos bugs e problemas de conexão, o jogo é bem desbalanceado. Por mais que adquira habilidade, tanto como killer quanto como survivor, determinados perks (skills adquiridas in-game) são extremamente desbalanceadas e, tendo em vista os anúncios das próximas atts, a beHavior tenta balancear o jogo (ou não) adicionando mais perks desbalanceados para o lado desfavorecido.

Tirando o mar de bugs e problemas, é inegável que você vai se divertir jogando, o estilo de jogo é diferente do usual e pode, ou melhor, vai te trazer horas de aproveitamento contanto que os bugs não te estressem o suficiente para fazer com que deixe de jogar.
Не покупайте это дерьмо,купите лучше нормальную хорошую игру,у разработчиков руки из жопы растут.

This Game is so much fun and I've had so many emotions while I was playing.
Sometimes I laughed my lungs bloody and sometimes I've got jumpscared my a** off.
You can have even have a blast by just fooling around as Killer.
BUT ONLY WHEN YOU PLAY WITH SOME GOOD FRIENDS!

When you play with some random people you will just called noob, camper, etc. (Depends if you lose or win)
In case you win as a Killer you will be called camper or you will blamed for tunneling and sometimes even insulted.
The only way to be not called a camper is to lose on purpose and that's not what I'm calling fun. 
When you lose as a killer you willl be called noob and get to told to learn how to play.

Even when I've got camped or tunneled I still had a good time, because a killer do what he needs to do to secure a kill/win and it was a challenge for me.
Even better I had a blast when I survived these situation while my heart was pumping pure f***ing adrenalin in my veins. 
But this feeling didn't last long because I've got insulted right after...   

Seriously, it's just a game. There's no need to get salty. Just have fun.
My Conclusion:
Just play with friends and have a great amount of fun. 
Don't play with random people because the community is way to toxic.
PS: Sorry for my bad english...

I have an intense love/hate relationship with Dead by Daylight, and I feel as though I've logged enough hours into it to write a fair review. If you're just here wondering if the community is as toxic as everyone says it is ... well, yes, it is. I wouldn't say it's any more or less toxic than the communities you'd find in CS:GO, Overwatch, Fortnite, etc. ... but post-game chat can definitely frighten off a new player.

If you're new to the game, I highly recommend playing it with one or more experienced friends who can coach you. If you don't have a thick skin or much patience, playing solo right off the bat will likely make you rage quit. That being said, a lot of people will only have fun with DbD if they're playing with friends. And that's okay and completely fair. The basis of 4v1 gameplay is cooperation, and you can't guarantee that a random is going to have your back.

This game is trash. It has a $20 base price, and if you only purchase that, 75% of the game is locked behind a egregious paywall. It has mobile game levels of locked content, it's abhorrent. In order to get everything the game has to offer, you will have to fork over $200 or more, all this on top of the baseline $20. The game is not  in a acceptable state, despite getting regular updates and patches for 4 years after it's launch. Bugs are a frequent occurrence. One of the most common ones I have encountered, is once a survivor is hooked by the killer, they freeze and nobody can save them. The gameplay is really fun, this would be one of the best games I have played if not for the anti-consumer, mobile game level of cash grab, and poor state of the game. It's still bugged to fuck.

Do yourself a favor and delete this game from your mind permanently. Nothing good will ever come from playing this game; server tick rates are abominable, little to no hitbox validation, nothing to prevent VPN killers (higher the ping = higher the chance of getting hit across the map), countless bugs and errors, killers can just tunnel players out of the game within minutes, Devs just release new cosmetic items to distract us from issues instead of fixing horrible and game-breaking problems, when they do fix one problem, it just breaks 10 other things, pallets and windows are only safe if the killer has decent internet, and a whole list of other nonsense. Also, don't think you can simply leave a toxic game either because you just might get a time penalty depending on the day of the week.
TLDR; it's okay. Get it on a Steam sale.
